structure.unit: AGRICULTURAL SEEDS, FEEDING STUFFS, AND FERTILIZERS

law.text:
As used in KRS 250.483 to 250.488:
"Department" means the Department of Insurance;
"Division" means the Division of Fire Prevention in the Department of Housing, Buildings and Construction.
"Anhydrous ammonia" refers to the compound formed by the combination of the two (2) gaseous elements, nitrogen and hydrogen, in the proportion of one (1) part nitrogen to three (3) parts of hydrogen by volume. Anhydrous ammonia is ammonia gas in compressed or liquefied form, and is not aqueous ammonia.
"Approved container" means a container for anhydrous ammonia which meets or exceeds the requirements of the Federal law or regulation for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 602, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 233, sec. 1, effective July 14, 2000. -- Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 188, sec. 235, effective July 15, 1980. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 62, sec. 1.
